alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 5:50PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...SOUTHERN MUSKINGUM AND WESTERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EST... At 550 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Somerset to 6 miles southwest of New Lexington. Movement was east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Cambridge, New Concord, Byesville, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Philo, Pleasant Grove, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, and Lore City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 143 and 189. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 27 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for east central Ohio.
